course_title: Topics in Literary History: English Epic Poetry
class_notes:
You must have permission to enroll in-person. 
(This course dives into epic poetry composed in the English language from John Milton (1608-1674) to Derek Walcott (1930-2017), to discover and work through epic poetic technique while exploring verse-based storytelling over a long span of time and space. Reading completely, or in part, poems written by the likes of Pope, Blake, Browning, Southey, Chesterton, Benet, Longfellow, H.D., Tighe, Morris, Brooks, Byron and those aforementioned, plus more-as time allows-will provide an historical and literary overview that stands apart from lyric poetry and proves challenging and rewarding in equal measure.)
(Note: Although not required, being familiar with other epic or heroic-style poems (particularly, the Iliad, Odyssey, Aeneid, Metamorphoses, Commedia, and Faery Queene) will be helpful since the poems we will read are based in no small part on significant aspects of these earlier works.)
